reg:regulation.reg:title: Cannabis Control and Licensing Transitional Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Cannabis Control and Licensing Act;
medical cannabis has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Cannabis Control Regulation;
proof of authority to possess medical cannabis has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Cannabis Control Regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation and in Divisions 1 and 2 of Part 5 of the Act and section 5 (3) (b) of the Cannabis Licensing Regulation, any reference to authority or permission under the Cannabis Act (Canada) to possess medical cannabis or to possess or grow cannabis plants that are medical cannabis includes any such authority or permission under the order of the Federal Court of Canada in Allard v. Canada, 2016 FC 237.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 52 of the Act, an adult who is carrying proof of authority to possess medical cannabis must not possess in a public place an amount of cannabis that is more than the sum of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the maximum amount of medical cannabis that the adult is permitted to possess under the Cannabis Act (Canada), and
30 g of dried cannabis or an amount of cannabis that is equivalent, as determined in accordance with the regulations, to 30 g of dried cannabis.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply to cannabis that is a cannabis plant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Possession of cannabis plants — cumulative quantity
bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite section 53 (1) and (2) of the Act, an adult who is carrying proof of authority to possess medical cannabis must not possess in a public place a number of cannabis plants that is more than the sum of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the maximum number of cannabis plants that are medical cannabis that the adult is permitted to possess under the Cannabis Act (Canada), and

bcl:section.bcl:text: In section 56 (c) of the Act, the reference to "4 cannabis plants" is to be read as a reference to "4 cannabis plants that are not medical cannabis".

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Personal growing — cumulative quantity for one resident
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 58 of the Act, it is also a requirement that if the site is a dwelling house at which only one adult ordinarily resides, no more cannabis plants are growing at the site than the sum of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the maximum number of cannabis plants that are medical cannabis that the adult is authorized under the Cannabis Act (Canada) to grow at the site, and

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Personal growing — cumulative quantity for 2 or more residents
bcl:section.bcl:text: In section 58 (d) (ii) of the Act, the reference to "4 cannabis plants, if one or more of the adults is not authorized to grow cannabis plants that are medical cannabis" is to be read as a reference to "4 cannabis plants".
Despite section 17 (f) of the Act, an adult who is in lawful possession of cannabis must not deliver the cannabis to another adult for compensation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person, other than the government, must not use any cannabis-related words, phrases, designs, domain names or other branding elements or indicia that could indicate that the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is exercising a function of the government, or
has any authority from the government that the person does not actually have.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a licensee and the licensee's employees and agents, when acting under the authority of the licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A contravention of either of the following provisions is prescribed to be an offence:
A person who commits an offence referred to in section 10 is liable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a corporation, to a fine of not more than $50 000,
in the case of an individual who is a licensee, to a fine of not more than $50 000 or to imprisonment for not more than 6 months, or to both, and
in the case of an individual who is not a licensee, to a fine of not more than $10 000 or to imprisonment for not more than 6 months, or to both.
